required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Common Allergens in Skin Tests for Adult Atopic Dermatitis
clinical_study.official_title: Common Allergens in Skin Tests for Adult Atopic Dermatitis

brief_summary.textblock: To analyze the common allergens revealed by skin tests in adult atopic dermatitis patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The allergens involved in atopic patients are widely existed in our environment. Traditionally, we use serum specific IgE, skin prick test or intradermal test to verify the possible causative allergens in patients with atopic dermatitis. This study will evaluate the correlation between serum specific IgE, skin prick test, intradermal test, and patch test for common allergens in adult patients with atopic dermatitis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with atopic dermatitis (according to Hanifin and Rajka criteria)
- age older than 16 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Dermatology, National Taiwan University Hospital

facility.name: Department of Dermatology, National Taiwan University Hospital
